answers.answer: We do hear some success with acupuncture. They are trained for 4 years. They can touch and say that the point is not active. As the problem is many sided, it is difficult to say anything about prognosis. You may try for some time and if you find some change you may continue, otherwise cancehe treatment.

question: My is trying acupuncture for his neck, back & shoulder pain. He has degenerative disk disorder in 3 lower disks, cracked cup and nerve damage in his shoulder and severe neck pain all this after several accidents. He is now on heavy pain tablets which no one else is on this level.  He is already on medication for diabetes, blood pressure,  liver, and diastotic disfunction in his heart plus sleep apnea and losing weight without trying or needing plus lack of appetite.  The Chinese medicine dr is going to help over several sessions plus he has to drink the not tasty herb tea 2x a day. Before we sink anymore  $$$$ into this does anyone have any ideas or answers about whether there is success in this type of procedure as the Chinese dr also said his body is trying to give up. He is only 47. Please someone help.
